item.title: सेतुबन्धम्
item.description: श्रीप्रवरसेनविरचितम् सेतुबन्धम् ० Introduction - GSS Murthy Setubandham (also called Rāvaṇavadhaḥ) is an epic composed in Mahārāṣṭrī, one of the Prākṛt languages, by King Pravarasena. This epic whose subject matter is the story of Yuddhakāṇḍa of Rāmāyaṇa has 15 cantos called āśvāsas with a total of 1291 verses. The first eight cantos of the epic having 600 verses in total is being presented in this publication. The text of each verse in Mahārāṣṭrī and its Sanskrit chāyā in devanāgarī script are followed by its Engliish translation in prose.
